Name: General tolerances
Text:
-General tolerances according to ISO 2768-mK:
  Linear dimensions: ±0.1 mm (m-class, medium)
  Angular dimensions: ±0.5° (K-class)
-Surface roughness according to ISO 1302
  unless otherwise specified: Ra 3.2 μm (N8)

Name: Sharp edges
Text:
-Remove sharp edges and deburr according to ISO 13715.
-Edge break: 0.1-0.3 mm unless otherwise specified.
-No burrs permitted on finished parts.

Name: Welding
Text:
-Welds according to ISO 2553.
-All welds continuous unless otherwise specified.
-Welding process: 141 (GTAW/TIG) according to ISO 4063.
-Remove welding spatter completely.
-Welds shall be free from cracks, porosity, and undercut.

Name: Sheetmetal bending
Text:
-Minimum inside bend radius: ≥ 1.0 × t (material thickness).
-Bend angle tolerance: ±1° unless otherwise specified.
-Do not crack, tear or excessively thin the material at bends.
-Maintain material temper condition. Do not anneal unless specified.

Name: Tube bending
Text:
-Minimum inside bend radius: ≥ 2.0 × D (tube outer diameter).
-Wall thickness reduction: maximum 10% at bend.
-Do not crack, tear or excessively thin the material at bends.
-Maintain material temper condition.

Name: Assembly
Text:
-Flatness and perpendicularity according to ISO 1101.
-Assembly dimensions take precedence over individual part dimensions.
-Check fit and function before final assembly.

Name: Welded assembly
Text:
-Check alignment of welded parts within ±0.5 mm before welding.
-Fixture and clamp parts to prevent distortion.
-Verify dimensions after welding and cooling.

Name: Inspection of dimensions
Text:
-All dimensions in millimeters unless otherwise specified.
-All dimensions apply after heat treatment, welding, and finish machining.
-Inspection temperature: 20°C ±2°C (ISO 1).

Name: Inspection welding
Text:
-General welding tolerances according to ISO 13920, tolerance class B.
-Visual inspection of welds according to ISO 17637, acceptance level B.
-Weld surface shall be free from cracks, porosity, and spatter.

Name: CAD is master
Text:
-3D CAD model is the master reference.
-In case of discrepancy between drawing and model, CAD model takes precedence.
-Contact engineering for clarification.

Name: CNC machining general
Text:
-All machined surfaces: Ra 3.2 μm (N8) unless otherwise specified.
-Break sharp edges 0.1-0.3 mm unless otherwise specified.
-Remove all burrs and sharp edges.
-Clean parts after machining.

Name: Thread specifications
Text:
-All threads ISO metric standard (ISO 68-1) unless otherwise specified.
-Thread tolerance class: 6H/6g (medium fit).
-Threads to be clean and free from chips and burrs.
-Check thread with GO/NO-GO gauges.

Name: Hole drilling
Text:
-All drilled holes perpendicular to surface ±0.5° unless otherwise specified.
-Hole position tolerance: ±0.1 mm unless otherwise specified.
-Deburr hole entry and exit.
-Drill diameter tolerance: ISO 286 H11.

Name: Tapping
Text:
-Tap holes after all heat treatment operations.
-Thread engagement: minimum 1.5 × nominal diameter for steel.
-Tapped holes to be clean and free from swarf.
-Use cutting fluid during tapping operation.

Name: Milling and facing
Text:
-Surface flatness: 0.05 mm per 100 mm unless otherwise specified.
-Surface finish: Ra 3.2 μm (N8) for general milling.
-Remove cutter marks if specified.
-Check dimensional accuracy after machining.

Name: Heat treatment general
Text:
-Heat treatment according to material specification.
-Provide machining allowance for distortion: +0.3 to +0.5 mm per side.
-All dimensions apply after heat treatment.
-Material certification (EN 10204 3.1) required.

Name: Hardening
Text:
-Harden to [specify HRC range, e.g., 58-62 HRC].
-Quench medium: [specify: oil/water/polymer/air].
-Tempering: [specify temperature and time].
-Measure hardness at locations marked on drawing.

Name: Stress relieving
Text:
-Stress relieve at [specify temperature, typically 550-650°C] for [time, typically 2-4 hours].
-Perform after rough machining, before finish machining.
-Slow cooling in furnace to room temperature.
-Prevents distortion during final machining.

Name: Carburizing
Text:
-Case depth: [specify, e.g., 0.5-0.8 mm] measured at 550 HV.
-Surface hardness: [specify, e.g., 58-62 HRC].
-Core hardness: [specify, e.g., 30-40 HRC].
-Carburizing according to ISO 2639.

Name: Nitriding
Text:
-Nitriding process: [specify: gas/plasma/salt bath].
-Case depth: [specify, e.g., 0.1-0.3 mm].
-Surface hardness: [specify, e.g., 650-850 HV].
-Nitriding after all machining operations.

Name: Coating general
Text:
-Apply coating after all machining, welding, and heat treatment.
-Mask threaded holes, bearing surfaces, and locating features.
-Coating thickness: [specify] μm.
-Coating adhesion test according to ISO 2409.

Name: Anodizing aluminum
Text:
-Anodize according to ISO 7599.
-Type II sulfuric acid anodizing unless otherwise specified.
-Anodizing thickness: [specify, typically 5-25 μm].
-Color: [specify RAL/Pantone] or natural.
-Seal anodized surface (hot water or dichromate seal).

Name: Powder coating
Text:
-Powder coat after degreasing and phosphate treatment.
-Coating thickness: 60-80 μm (ISO 2808).
-Color: RAL [specify number].
-Gloss level: [specify: matte/satin/gloss].
-Cure according to powder manufacturer specifications.

Name: Electroplating
Text:
-Plating type: [specify: zinc/nickel/chrome/tin].
-Plating thickness: [specify] μm.
-Zinc plating: ISO 2081, Fe/Zn [thickness][chromate].
-Nickel plating: ISO 1458.
-Check plating thickness with coating gauge.

Name: Passivation stainless steel
Text:
-Passivate stainless steel according to ASTM A967.
-Process: [specify: citric acid/nitric acid].
-Remove free iron contamination before passivation.
-Final rinse with deionized water.
-Salt spray test: minimum 24 hours (ASTM B117).

Name: Sheetmetal tolerances
Text:
-Bend angle tolerance: ±1° unless otherwise specified.
-Hole position tolerance: ±0.15 mm.
-Bend line position: ±0.5 mm.
-Flatness: ±0.5 mm per 100 mm unless otherwise specified.

Name: Sheetmetal finishing
Text:
-Deburr all edges to 0.1-0.3 mm radius.
-Grind sharp edges smooth where specified.
-Remove all weld spatter and discoloration.
-Clean parts: degrease and remove cutting fluid residue.

Name: Sheetmetal forming
Text:
-Grain direction: form bends perpendicular to rolling direction when possible.
-No cracks, tears, or orange peel at formed features.
-Spring-back compensation included in tooling.
-Minimum distance from hole to bend: 2.5 × material thickness.

Name: Welding preparation
Text:
-Clean weld areas before welding: remove oil, grease, paint, rust, scale.
-Bevel edges according to joint design (ISO 9692-1).
-Root gap and land dimensions as specified.
-Preheat material if required by welding procedure.

Name: Post-weld treatment
Text:
-Remove slag, spatter, and oxidation from all welds.
-Grind welds flush where specified (indicate on drawing).
-Visual inspection: no cracks, porosity, undercut, or incomplete fusion.
-Stress relieve welded assemblies if specified.

Name: Weld symbols
Text:
-Welding symbols according to ISO 2553.
-Arrow side vs. other side clearly indicated.
-Weld size, length, and pitch as specified.
-Finish symbols: C (chipping), G (grinding), M (machining).

Name: Material certification
Text:
-Material test certificate required: EN 10204 Type 3.1.
-Certificate must show: chemical composition, mechanical properties, heat number.
-Traceability: mark parts with heat number or batch code.
-Retain certificates for quality records.

Name: First article inspection
Text:
-First article inspection (FAI) required before production.
-Submit dimensional report with measured values for all features.
-Include material certification and process certifications.
-Approval required before continuing production.

Name: Non-destructive testing
Text:
-NDT method: [specify: UT/RT/MT/PT/ET].
-Acceptance criteria: [specify standard and level].
-Test frequency: [specify: 100%/sampling/first article].
-Mark tested parts with inspector stamp and date.
-Record and retain NDT reports.

Name: Dimensional inspection
Text:
-Measure all critical dimensions marked with ⊕ or boxed.
-Use calibrated measuring equipment (traceable to national standards).
-Inspection temperature: 20°C ±2°C.
-Record measurements on inspection report.
-Parts out of tolerance to be quarantined.

Name: Fastener specifications
Text:
-All fasteners ISO metric standard unless otherwise specified.
-Tightening torque: [specify] Nm (use calibrated torque wrench).
-Apply threadlocker: [specify type and locations].
-Washers: use where specified on assembly drawing.
-Check fastener engagement: minimum 1.5 × diameter.

Name: Assembly sequence
Text:
-Follow assembly sequence as specified in work instructions.
-Apply lubricant/grease to [specify locations and type].
-Check for free movement and proper fit during assembly.
-Verify subassembly dimensions before final assembly.
-Torque fasteners in specified sequence.

Name: Bearing installation
Text:
-Press fit bearings: use arbor press with support fixture.
-Heat bearings to [specify temperature, typically 80-100°C] before installation.
-Do not heat bearings above 120°C.
-Ensure bearings seat properly against shoulders.
-Lubricate bearings after installation.

Name: Geometric tolerances
Text:
-Geometric tolerances according to ISO 1101 (GD&T).
-Datum reference frame as indicated on drawing.
-Tolerance zone applies to entire feature unless otherwise specified.
-Maximum Material Condition (MMC) or Least Material Condition (LMC) as indicated.

Name: Surface finish specific
Text:
-Turned surfaces: Ra 3.2 μm (N8) unless otherwise specified.
-Milled surfaces: Ra 3.2 μm (N8).
-Ground surfaces: Ra 0.8 μm (N6).
-Lapped/honed surfaces: Ra 0.4 μm (N5).
-Polished surfaces: Ra 0.2 μm (N4).
-Lay direction indicated by symbol when critical.

Name: Positional tolerances
Text:
-Hole pattern positional tolerance: [specify] mm diameter.
-True position measured at Maximum Material Condition (MMC) unless stated.
-Datum reference: [specify datum features A, B, C].
-Verify position with functional gauge or CMM.
